definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units

sentences.english: Risk forecast and management is recently an interesting topic in the field of aids to navigation.
sentences.chinese: 风险预测及管理是国示航标界近年来颇为关注的话题。

sentences.english: Specialized units may act on their own to install special navigation marks.
sentences.chinese: 专业单位可以自行设置自用的专用航标。

sentences.english: A steady light beaconed from the shore.
sentences.chinese: 岸上一束亮光起了航标的作用。

sentences.english: Harbor inland river pharos illumination power source.
sentences.chinese: 港湾内河航标灯照明电源。

sentences.english: On the coast, this clearly shows features as small as canals, and many coastal navigation lights.
sentences.chinese: 在海岸线上你可以清楚的看到小的之流，航标灯。

sentences.english: Over the ocean there were no landmarks to set him right.
sentences.chinese: 在大海上没有航标使得他正确无误。

definition: course/direction (a ship or plane is heading in)
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
